properties.description: 'This rule identifies requests made to atypical URLs, as malware can exploit IP addresses for communication with command-and-control (C2) servers. The detection identifies network requests that contain either plain text or Base64 encoded IP addresses. Alerts are triggered when a private IP address is observed as plain text or base64 encoded in an outbound web request. This method of concealing the IP address was observed in the utilization of the RunningRAT tool by POLONIUM.'
properties.name: Detect presence of private IP addresses in URLs (ASIM Web Session)

alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: User '{{SrcUsername}}' has been detected requesting URL '{{Urls}}' that contains private IP address '{{ip_inURL}}'. Encoding private IP addresses in a URL can be a method used by attackers to exfiltrate data from a compromised system
alertDetailsOverride.alertDisplayNameFormat: Detected a private ip address '{{ip_inURL}}' carved in URL
